page.title: 04Crynant Community Council.
page.content: In 1974, the Local Government Act set up Community Councils in Wales (although Parish Councils still remain in England). For a great many years the Dulais Valley was governed by two councils - Dylais Higher and Dylais Lower Parish (later Community) Councils. In 1983 the valley was re-organised to form three Councils - Onllwyn, Seven Sisters and Crynant. The powers of a Community Council are limited by statute. In Crynant the Council has spent a lot of money (raised froma local 'rate') renewing all the wayside seats, repairing the playground equipment, providing a B.M.X. cycle track and cleaning up the cemetery. The Council has also made substantial financial grants to many local voluntary organisations whose work is of benefit to the community.
